intro: Saussurea xianrendongensis, commonly known as the Xianrendong safflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cold and arid conditions. Its botanical features include fibrous roots and pinnately lobed leaves, which help it survive in its harsh habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered an important species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
